title: Morellonomican and its lost Identity
body:
I'm writing this post cause I'm feeling a little weird about the new Morellonomican (Well relatively new, I guess :P)

So as we know, every item in-game is built to have its own uses and appeal. You build Infinity Edge to get that extra 50% Crit Damage, and you build Mercurial Scimitar if your an AD having problem with CC. Do you see where this is going?

With the mid season mage update, they changed A LOT of items and added a few more. With this, they changed something drastic: Mana. It used to be where if you have mana problems, Athene's or Tear was what you were to lean to, but now with the changes to Athene's, with an exception of a few mid laners, its useless to buy for your normal common mid laners such as Ahri or Annie. So now your left with two items at your disposal: Morellonomicon or Archangels. The alure of Archangels is a _mana_ based build. Because of this, most characters do not fit this archetype because they don't spam abilities enough, however there IS another reason. So now we look at Morellonomicon. Morellonomicons "Unique" identity is supposed to be an item that you build if the enemy is sustaining using heals. However, its stats make it lose its identity. At 100 AP, 400 Mana, 20% CDR, Grievious Wounds, and then its "restore 20% of your mana per kill or assist" it makes it a great item.

So lets do a quick analysis, starting with gold efficiency. Gold Efficiency is a term used to describe how much your paying for each stat using the base values provided from simple items that provide that single stat. So for example, to calculate the base cost of AP, we would take amplifying tomb and take its 20 AP and divide it by its cost, 435g. this makes each point of ap roughly worth 21.75g. We can then plug in these values in other items to find roughly what the cost of CDR, Mana, and other stats are.

So after you do all this, you come with a gold efficiency for Morellonomicon roughly 113% WITHOUT the passives. In comparison, Athene's Unholy Grail is at 99% gold efficiency, while Archangels is only 73% Gold Efficient unless you stack mana items, finally reaching 100% efficiency at 1300 mana from items.

And this is WITHOUT the passive. Archangels automatically loses because its gold efficiency was calculated WITH the passives. And if we included Athene's passives, the efficiency goes up to 121%, but because of its new unique identity, its useless on most normal mid laners.

In conclusion, what I'm saying is that Morellonomicon has lost its identity as a item solely built to counter people with high sustain, now its used as an item solely for its mana, many people forgetting its intended use. Now this doesn't seem like a problem, but being a support main for close to two years now, I prefer supports where I can actively sustain my team through a teamfight, such as Janna, Nami, or Soraka. But with Morellonomican being built on EVERY mid laner, it makes it hard for me to do so. And it would be one thing if I KNEW they built it because of sustain, but I guarantee that is not the case in 90% of the games (seeing as i'm only in silver, most people (no offense!) do not have the smarts to counter build against a support). Also, proof of this can be seen whenever you play a game without any sustain characters at all. I know for a fact that whenever I play a game, the first item I see mid laners rush is Morello, it being used as a font for mana, high AP, and quite a bit of CDR.

So what is everyone elses thoughts on this? Place it in the comments below! =D

Okay, history lesson for people. 

On May 1st 2012, a grievous wounds passive was added to Morellonomicon. These were the days of DFG ruling the rift, but it was also a time when sustain champs were so powerful that they needed some uniform way to counter them for mages, cause tanks could get to the point where a Leblanc would burst them and they'd return to full health in seconds, or heal up using one of the many healing supports, sustain ults, and other things.

Back then, if you wanted CDR, you built Athene's and Ionian Boots over Morello, cause together they gave way more CDR and mana regen, so the only reason was to buy Morello was to counter sustain.

Proof can even be seen if you look at statistics. Before patch 6.9, Morello was only used in 0.12% of all matches, meaning that Morellonomicon was only bought in certain circumstances. After however, this changed. Morellonomicon is now built on AP mid laners _83%_ of the time, and almost always as the first item, because its new mana passive restores a ludicrous amount of mana.

It seems as though you are deciding the identity of Morello based on your own personal experience and then cherry picking scenarios and parts of the item's history in order to validate your opinion. I've only been playing since season five, but from what I have gathered, the item has been the central hub of early offense given it's access to cdr/mana/ap stats with an added GW passive just to give a bone to mages (who don't even need the passive). 

Seeing as the massive majority of mages inherently are built towards burst as opposed to long drawn out combat I don't really see the GW passive making a massive difference in fights anyway, which is probably why GW doesn't receive its' own niche item. Such a creation would probably be pushed aside with ohmwrecker due to how rarely it would actually be useful, so I understand why it is slapped onto a core item. 

As far as using gold efficiency to argue why Morello is taken so often I think it is actually a moot argument at this point given the way that Mage itemization was reworked so as to unify and eliminate redundency across the AP items. Seraphs/Morello/Athene's were molded to specifically fit wildly different kinds of mages and should not be considered interchangeable in my opinion. (really, the mages who benefit from seraphs are the ones who would even need the GW passive. You could make an argument for the passive in that regard, but you opted to simply slam Morello because you simply don't like the identity that Riot created the item to fill).
